summary: This is a search and seizure warrant issued by the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the search of Jeffrey Epstein's residence at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY. The warrant seeks evidence related to violations of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy, specifically targeting electronic devices and media containing communications, photographs, and records related to victims and the offenses. The warrant was executed on July 6, 2019.

persons.name: Henry Pitman
persons.context: Issued the search and seizure warrant for the premises at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY.

events.title: Search Warrant Issued
events.description: U.S. Magistrate Judge Henry Pitman issued a search and seizure warrant for the premises at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, related to violations of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

events.title: Search Warrant Executed
events.description: The search warrant was executed at 9 East 71st Street, New York, NY, resulting in the seizure of numerous electronic devices and storage media.

locations: 9 East 71st Street, New York, New York
keyFacts: The search warrant targeted Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence at 9 East 71st Street for evidence of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.
The warrant specifically authorized seizure of electronic devices and storage media containing communications, photographs, and records related to victims and the offenses.
The warrant was issued on July 2, 2019, and executed on July 6, 2019, just days before Epstein's arrest on July 6, 2019.
The legal basis cited was violations of Title 18, United States Code, Sections 371 (conspiracy) and 1591 (sex trafficking of minors).

The warrant included provisions for forensic imaging of devices and detailed search protocols for electronically stored information, including nude or sexually suggestive photographs of teenage girls or younger.
